ca.forklabs.javaxpcom.select
Class Selector

java.lang.Object
  ca.forklabs.javaxpcom.select.Selector

public class Selector
extends Object

Class Selector matches a list of nodes in a document.

A selector is created from a root node, usually the document itself. An easy way to get a selector is to use Crawler.selector() and work from that instance. Shortcut methods are provided to create and add filters to narrow the selection.

Once filters have been applied, the list matching nodes can be gotten by calling list(). Once the list has been gotten, the selector instance should be discarded.

From ca.forklabs.javaxpcom.ProjectPageCrawler#exploreMainMenu(): 

    List anchors = this.selector()
                       .element("a")
                       .attribute("class", "tab")
                       .list();
gives the list of the five menu items at the top of this project page

The selector works a little bit like the $() variable from jQuery.

Version:
$Revision$
